page.title: 09Village amenities
page.content: Amenities in Wysall have diminished since the mid 1970s. There is no lon- ger a butcher's shop, general store or post office; this may be due in part to the fact that most families own a car and can travel to large supermar- kets, which have larger stocks and lower prices. A mobile greengrocery service calls once a week, a butcher and a baker each call twice a week, a fishmonger (female) once a week and also a library van once a fortnight. A post office service is held every Thursday for 2 hours, run by the post- mistress from Willoughby, who will also bring items from her shop if asked by 'phone. Widmerpool has no shops. There is no doctor in the block; residents must travel to Key- worth, East Leake or Barrow upon Soar. Newspapers brought from East Leake to Wysall are delivered by local children
